Body:
"Everybody [?] knows" that there are these pairs of corresponding words in German and English in which an "f" appears in German where a "p" appears in English:

Bischoff, bishop

Schiff, ship

offen, open

hoffen, hope

(The initial letters of German nouns are capital.)

My question is whether some book or web page has tabulated a moderately comprehensive list of examples of this, and of other similar phenomena?
Title: Tabulated lists of examples

OwnerUser.AboutMe: After doing nearly all the coursework for a Ph.D. in math, I then did all the coursework for a Ph.D. in statistics and completed that degree.
